text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Osama a technical account
manager here at AWS office in Dublin
today I'll show you how to troubleshoot
429 too many requests or limit exceeded
errors from an API Gateway rest API
let's get
started API Gateway has account level
quas per region the total CA is 10,000
requests per second with an additional
burst capacity provided by the token
bucket algorithm the maximum bucket
capacity is 5,000 requests per account
per region setting related to API
Gateway throttling are applied in the
following order per client or per method
throttling limits that you set for an
API stage in a usage plan per method
throttling limits that you set for an
API stage account level throttling per
region AWS Regional throttling exceeding
the throttling limits or CA returns a 4
to9 too many requests or limit exceeded
error response now let's see how we can
troubleshoot this issue using Amazon
cloudwatch
logs log into the AWS Management console
make sure you have turned on a error
loging for the sdpi Gateway for further
information find the knowledge Center
article Linked In the video description
after turning on the error loging
navigate to the API Gateway
console and the API Gateway console
select the API from the list of your
apis from the left of the page under
resources choose
stages select the stage that is
returning 4 to9 too many requests error
check the rate or burst limit for the
API stage by default all the resources
and methods for your API inherit the
rate that you configure for a stage if
you overload the resource and Method
level throttling limits you can select
the method under the configured resource
to view the rate and burst Limit
if you use a usage plan with API Gateway
choose usage plans from the left side
and then choose the usage plan that you
are using with the API Gateway rest API
to view the throttling error that
results from the rate limit burst Limit
or Kota first copy the API Gateway ID
choose the apis from the left
side and then copy the API ID navigate
to the cloud watch
console from the left pen under logs
choose logs insights
in the search bar paste the API Gateway
ID that you copied earlier choose the
log group for the relevant
stage adjust the time as
needed and then replace the query with
the following login s sites
query note that you can copy this query
from the video description choose run
query after the query return the results
expand the logs to check check the
error the error key throttle limit
exceeded tells you that the rate or
burst limit for the API was exceeded to
resolve this error use retries and an
exponential back of algorithm with
Jitter and then resubmit your API
request the error API key exceeded Kota
limit tells you that the configured CA
limit was exceeded to resolve this error
you can extend the remaining qua from
the API Gateway console and now you know
how to troubleshoot 4 to9 too many
requests or limit exceeded errors for an
API Gateway rest
API thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
